features: ASUS Vivobook Pro 15 laptop comes with 15.6” FHD (1920 x 1080) 16:9 aspect ratio with 144Hz refresh rate and ultra-slim NanoEdge bezels

Latest AMD RyzenTM 9 7940HS Mobile Processor 4.0GHz (8-core/16-thread, 16MB cache, up to 5.2GHz max boost) with AMD RyzenTM AI technology built in providing all the power you need for intense workloads
NVIDIA Geforce RTX 4060 Laptop GPU, with 8GB GDDR6
Fast storage and memory featuring 1TB M.2 NVMe PCIe 3.0 SSD and 32GB LPDDR5X RAM, Windows 11 Home
Backlit Chiclet Keyboard and FingerPrint reader
body.description: Shape your wonderland becomes easier than ever with the powerful Vivobook Pro 15. Its AMD Ryzen™ 7000 series Mobile Processor and NVIDIA® GeForce® RTX™ 4060 Laptop graphics deliver maximum performance thanks to the dual-fan cooling system. Your creations will impress the world with such supreme power, and USB 4.0 Gen 3 Type-C gives you speedy and convenient connections. Your creations will impress the world with such ultimate power. Vivobook Pro 15 comes with 15.6” FHD (1920 x 1080) 16:9 aspect ratio with ultra-slim NanoEdge bezels. Unlock Vivobook Pro 15 laptop with the built-in fingerprint sensor on the touchpad and Windows Hello. It also has a sleek and lightweight aluminum body at only 3.97 lbs and 0.74 inches thick.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect laptop for this price
reviews.reviewText: The perfect laptop for gaming, business, and entertainment activities. Great battery life, nice and convenient keyboard. The weakest part of this laptop is the screen, it's FullHD but that is perfectly fine for me. Basically, you can run all the newest games, watch movies, browse for more than 6 hours, or use it for development. The best laptop for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great laptop - Vivobook Pro Ryzen 9 7940HS $1,200+tax
reviews.reviewText: It has almost everything - excellent Ryzen 7940HS Mobile (4 nano, 8C/16T, 4.0-5.2GHz Turbo), Nvidia RTX 4060 GPU, 32GB 5500MHz LPDDR5, 150W, and a 1TB NVMe SSD.I haven't been able to stress it. Yet. I got it two days ago.The "almost" above: One complaint. It has only one USB 3.1 port, wasting a position with a second USB 2.0 port.I bought one for my son a couple of weeks ago.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth Every Penny
reviews.reviewText: For the money, it's an amazing deal. Runs great, very light but not flimsy or too fragile. Needed it for video editing and while I haven't gotten to use it yet, I was recommended this laptop for this very reason. Compared to my last laptop I bought in 2010, which was also $1200 that weighted 15 lbs, this is a massive improvement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The screen is the weakest part
reviews.reviewText: I bought this without finding any reviews online. Here's my take. This laptop is light, thin and has great battery life with web browsing. It doesn't get too warm with day to day tasks, it can sit on your lap without cooking it which is something many gaming laptops can't do. It charges over usb-c and the 150w power brick (not usb-c) is small. Overall performance is great for the size.Updated Review: Turning off "Smooth edges of images and text" In Windows made a difference in text readability.But the screen is the weakest part. It's "okay." Just bright enough but I wish it was brighter. It's rated at 250 nits (though it feels a bit brighter), at 1920x1080, 45% ntsc. Colors are good enough but aren't amazing. Viewing angles are okay. It's decent and usable, not horrible but I expect better. If you come a laptop with a great screen this will be a noticeable step down. I did get used to it over time but there were times when I was in a bright room that I wished the laptop was just a bit brighter. Response time is fine.The 4060 doesn't have a mux switch and is capped at 80w. Performance was more inline with a higher powered 4050 out of the box. With tweaking you can get it to low-end 4060 levels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best you can get from a ryzen ultrabook (for now)
reviews.reviewText: Original M2 drive stucks, only one m2 sucket, changed to a big one (4tb).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Display freezes up
reviews.reviewText: Overall a great computer but the display freezes for about 20 seconds then resets. This happened about once per hour on average possibly due to the junk RTX 4060 video card, but whatever the cause, I would not expect that out of a gaming computer. Returned it for a refund.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Asus Vivobook 15 Pro
reviews.reviewText: Laptop has a great professional look. Light and portable, and still great performance!

La verdad no le veo ninguna cosa mala, la batería dura bastante, la calidad de imagen es excelente, el sonido muy bueno, las especificaciones son increíbles con su excelente procesador, su GPU y la RAM no puedo pedir más para una laptop. Lo recomiendo muchísimo, si lo pueden agarrar en oferta mejor.
